name: Kishwar Chowdhury
bio: Passionate chef with a flair for creative fusion cuisine. Dedicated to elevating flavors, sourcing local ingredients, and delighting diners with unforgettable dishes.

recipe1.ingredients: Palak, Panner, Ghee, Garam Masala, Lemon Juice, Salt and pepper to taste
recipe1.recipe: For palak paneer, blanch 2 cups of spinach for 2 minutes, shock in ice water, then blend into a smooth paste. In a pan, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, ginger, and optionally 1 chopped green chili until golden. Add 2 chopped tomatoes, cook until soft, then stir in 1/2 tsp each of turmeric, coriander, and cumin powder, 1 tsp garam masala, and salt. Incorporate spinach paste, cook for 5-7 mins, add 200g cubed paneer, simmer for 5 mins, optionally add 1/4 cup cream, garnish with cilantro, and serve with naan or rice.

recipe2.ingredients: Chicken, Butter, Garam Masala, Yogurt, Salt and pepper to taste
recipe2.recipe: To make Palak Butter Chicken, marinate 500g of chicken with 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp each of turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala, and salt for 30 minutes. In a pan, heat 2 tbsp butter, sauté 1 chopped onion until golden, then add 2 chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add 2 cups of spinach puree and simmer for 5 minutes. In a separate pan, cook marinated chicken until tender, then add it to the spinach mixture. Finish with 2 tbsp of cream, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot.

recipe3.ingredients: Chana, Garam Masala, Butter, Lemon Juice, Salt and pepper to taste
recipe3.recipe: To prepare Palak Chana Masala, soak 1 cup of chickpeas overnight, then cook until tender. In a pan, heat 2 tbsp oil, sauté 1 chopped onion until golden, then add 2 minced garlic cloves, 1-inch grated ginger, and 2 chopped tomatoes, cooking until soft. Add 2 cups of spinach puree and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cooked chickpeas, 1 tsp each of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, and salt to taste. Simmer for another 10 minutes, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot.
